alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Interstate 5 Corridor; Malibu Coast; Santa Clarita Valley; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western San Fernando Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 4:42PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A line of strong showers and isolated thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Ventura and western Los Angeles Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 438 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong showers and isolated thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 7 miles west of Santa Clarita to 15 miles southwest of Point Dume. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could down trees, tree limbs, and power lines, and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thousand Oaks...Simi Valley...Fillmore...Encino...Woodland Hills... Malibu...Agoura Hills...Van Nuys...Chatsworth...Santa Clarita... Northridge...Moorpark...Sylmar...Newbury Park...Porter Ranch... Granada Hills...and Calabasas. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in OXNARD.
